attributes.action: Make all siblings a priority in school choices even those out of catchment area
attributes.additional_details: There are 12 parents who are in the same situation with just this one school.  How many others must be affected.
attributes.background: Siblings should have priority no matter if out off catchment area. I have a daughter who is starting senior school in September but was allocated a different senior school to her brother.  We have not moved since he was allocated his senior school.

rejection.details:
We cannot accept your petition in its current form as it is not clear what action you want either the UK Government or Parliament. A "sibling rule" already exists, which requires local authorities to prioritise places for children with siblings already at a school. 

You could start a new petition asking the Government to take a specific action, for example, to make it automatic that a place is given to a child with a sibling already at the school.
